etymologies: late 19th century; earliest use found in The British Medical Journal. From osteo- + arthropathy, after French ostéo-arthropathie

definitions: Any disorder that affects both bones and joints; especially in "hypertrophic pulmonary osteoarthropathy" noun a syndrome characterized by periosteal new bone formation involving the long bones and phalanges, a variable degree of arthritis, and often clubbing of the fingers, seen in association with pulmonary and various other diseases.
